Name: Python
Description: Primary language across EO ingestion, analytics, and production model workflows.

Name: GDAL + PROJ
Description: Foundational geospatial I/O and coordinate transformation stack for raster and vector processing.

Name: PostgreSQL + PostGIS
Description: Core transactional and spatial query layer that underpins many EO products and APIs.

Name: S3-Compatible Object Storage
Description: Baseline storage contract for cloud-native geospatial data lakes and tile assets.

Name: GeoPandas
Description: Core dataframe API for vector processing and geospatial data engineering.

Name: Rasterio
Description: Standard raster read/write and windowed access library in Python EO pipelines.

Name: Xarray
Description: Default multidimensional model for time-series and gridded EO analysis.

Name: Dask
Description: Parallel execution backbone for scaling EO preprocessing and analytics workloads.

Name: Apache Parquet
Description: Columnar storage baseline for high-volume geospatial tabular data.

Name: JupyterLab
Description: Primary interactive workspace for geospatial exploration, notebooks, and review.

Name: QGIS
Description: Default desktop GIS for spatial editing, QA, and analyst workflows.

Name: DuckDB + Spatial
Description: Fast local analytics on parquet and geospatial data with minimal setup.

Name: TiTiler
Description: Dynamic tile serving for raster assets and cloud-native imagery.

Name: Polars
Description: High-performance DataFrame processing for geospatial ETL support.

Name: Custom WebGL Terrain Pipelines
Description: Promising for advanced rendering, but complexity is still high.

Name: Human-in-the-Loop QA
Description: Critical review checkpoints before production release of new detections.

Name: Active Learning for Labeling
Description: Use model uncertainty to prioritize human review and reduce labeling costs.

Name: Edge Inference for EO
Description: Early-stage experiments for low-latency, low-bandwidth deployments.

Name: Semantic Search on Embeddings
Description: Supports cross-region similarity queries over EO features and annotations.

Name: Rule-Only Change Detection
Description: Too brittle alone; use in combination with learning-based methods.

Name: Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG)
Description: Primary raster format for cloud access and selective reads.

Name: OpenStreetMap
Description: Core baseline dataset for roads, places, and contextual mapping layers.
Tags: ["Data Repository", "Cartography and visualisation", "Geocoding and georeferencing", "Mobile data collection"]

Name: GeoParquet
Description: Preferred columnar format for vector analytics and lakehouse storage.

Name: Synthetic Training Data
Description: Useful for augmentation, but realism and bias controls need care.

Name: Heavy Shapefile Archives
Description: Legacy interchange format kept only where backward compatibility is required.

Name: STAC API
Description: Default interface for searchable geospatial catalogs and metadata discovery.

Name: OGC API - Features
Description: Modern replacement path for feature services where interoperability matters.

Name: PMTiles
Description: Single-file vector tile delivery with easy CDN distribution.

Name: GeoZarr
Description: Emerging chunked format for multidimensional geospatial arrays.

Name: Vendor-Locked Metadata Schemas
Description: Avoid when possible to reduce migration cost and integration risk.
